head.title: Jean A. Tuttle, James E. Carr

hedline.hl1: Jean A. Tuttle, James E. Carr

block.p: Jean Ann Tuttle, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James B. Tuttle of Barrington, Ill., was married yesterday to James Elson Carr, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elson Carr of Penn Valley, Calif. The Rev. Dr. Craig P. Baldacci, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the nondenominational ceremony at Long Grove Community Church in Long Grove, Ill.

Jean Ann Tuttle, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James B. Tuttle of Barrington, Ill., was married yesterday to James Elson Carr, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elson Carr of Penn Valley, Calif. The Rev. Dr. Craig P. Baldacci, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the nondenominational ceremony at Long Grove Community Church in Long Grove, Ill.

The bride, 37, and the bridegroom, 39, own design studios in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., she Jean Tuttle Illustration and he James Carr Design. The bride, who is keeping her name, graduated from Parsons School of Design. The bridegroom graduated from San Jose State University. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did that of the bride. WEDDINGS
